content.question:
Time (s)

<math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> 

<math alttext="negative 24.4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>24.4</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="negative 30.9" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>30.9</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> 

An astronaut performs an experiment near the surface of a moon by releasing an object at rest above a motion detector such that data can be collected about the object’s vertical velocity as a function of time. The data are provided in the table. Which of the following graphs most likely represents the shape of the curve of the magnitude of the gravitational field strength near the surface of the moon as a function of time?

choices.label: The figure presents a graph with a curve. The horizontal axis is labeled Time, in seconds, and the numbers 0, 5, and 10 are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled Gravitational Field Strength. The curve begins at the origin and moves to the right on the horizontal axis until it ends at 10 seconds.

The figure presents a graph with a curve. The horizontal axis is labeled Time, in seconds, and the numbers 0, 5, and 10 are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled Gravitational Field Strength. The curve begins near the top of the vertical axis and moves to the right, parallel to the horizontal axis, until it ends at 10 seconds.

The figure presents a graph with a curve. The horizontal axis is labeled Time, in seconds, and the numbers 0, 5, and 10 are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled Gravitational Field Strength. The curve begins at the origin and moves diagonally up and to the right, until it reaches approximately 7 seconds and the top of the vertical axis.

The figure presents a graph with a curve. The horizontal axis is labeled Time, in seconds, and the numbers 0, 5, and 10 are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled Gravitational Field Strength. The curve begins at the origin and curves upward and to the right, until it reaches 7 seconds and the top of the vertical axis.

content.answer: The figure presents a graph with a curve. The horizontal axis is labeled Time, in seconds, and the numbers 0, 5, and 10 are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled Gravitational Field Strength. The curve begins near the top of the vertical axis and moves to the right, parallel to the horizontal axis, until it ends at 10 seconds.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
